answers.answer: Hi there.Dizziness and weakness can come from various causes.  Low hemoglobin levels (red blood cells) can cause this as well as low or high blood pressure.  Metabolic abnormalities such as high blood sugar levels (diabetes) or thyroid problems (hyper or hypothyroid states) can also offer some explanation. Diabetes can also initially present as orthostatic hypotension (lowering of blood pressure upon abrupt standing) that can cause dizziness or blurred vision.  Local eye problems such as errors of refraction or astigmatism can cause these symptoms.  The negative scans all sound reassuring.  I suggest you discuss these other options with your doctors.  For now, have adequate rest and a good diet.  Regards.

I have suffered from Vertigo for over 10/12 years it comes without warning.  I wake up and get out of bed and almost fall over.  I have had bouts so bad before that I was throwing up with any movement.    I have been to an ENT and Neurologist who are supposed to be experts in the field and they gave me circ for the vertigo and the Neuroloigist gave me migraine medication.   The Circ did nothing for me but it does work for others.   I have just received the results from an MRI and have been diganosed with a Pineal Cyst in the brain.    If you look up Pineal Cyst on the internet you will find lots of people who suffer from Vertigo/Migraines have been diaganosed with these cysts.   I am waiting for another MRI and I want to be referred to a Neurologist, I'm not messing around with my GP.If anyone else has any info I would be happy to hear from them.  Regards
